PageTitle: peer default-route-advertise(BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise default routes to its peer.
The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default configuration. The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise default routes to its peer. The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default configuration. By default, a BGP device does not advertise any default route to its peer.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a route-policy.
The name is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.
